tooltip.divinityunbound.io_card_line_1: Shift+Right Click in air to clear
tooltip.divinityunbound.io_card_line_2: Right Click on block to save
tooltip.divinityunbound.unholy_wand: Pulls ores from underground to the surface
tooltip.divinityunbound.divine_wand_of_f: Provides flight for 1 minute on use
tooltip.divinityunbound.wand_of_respirat: Gives Water Breathing and Dolphins Grace
tooltip.divinityunbound.wand_of_the_arch: Shoots spectral arrows. Can be enchanted
tooltip.divinityunbound.wand_of_fire_ben: Summons temporary lava and gives fire resistance
tooltip.divinityunbound.wand_of_magnetiz: When active, pulls nearby items to you
tooltip.divinityunbound.celestial_glass1: Players can phase through, Mobs cannot.
tooltip.divinityunbound.dark_celestial_g: Players can phase through, Mobs cannot.
Acts like Tinted Glass. Hold Shift to stand on.
divinityunbound.page.raw_celestite0: $(item)Raw Celestite$(0) is found in small veins across the overworld. It then can be smelted and turned into $(item)Celestite$(0).
divinityunbound.page.celestite0: $(item)Celestite$(0) is a powerful magical metal that can be smelted from $(item)Raw Celestite$(0).$(p)Now that you've acquired some $(item)Celestite$(0) you can start to delve into the world of Divinity Unbound.
divinityunbound.page.chronos_clock0: You believe you've figured it out! At least the start of it anyways. You've figured out that you can make a $(item)Chronos Clock$(0) with some of the $(item)Celestite$(0) you've been able to collect and smelt.$(p)It is a little expensive to invest that much $(item)Celestite$(0) but it'll be worth it so you can begin your magical journey.
divinityunbound.page.celestite_infused_s: $(item)Celestite Infused Stone$(0) seems to emanate some sort of magical energy when $(item)Stone$(0) is infused with $(item)Celestite$(0).$(p)You think there might be something more to this.
divinityunbound.page.golden_celestite_in: $(item)Gold$(0) has always had some sort of magical properties. You start to wonder what would happen if you were to combine it with the already powerful $(item)Celestite Infused Stone$(0).
divinityunbound.page.grain_of_time0: A $(item)Grain of Time$(0) is actual time that has been distilled into grains by the $(item)Chronos Time Accumulator$(0).$(p)Having access to time in a physical form unlocks power and magic beyond your wildest dreams.
divinityunbound.page.grain_of_time1: A $(item)Grain of Time$(0) can be crafted into $(item)Sand of Time$(0) or be converted into more powerful forms of magic like $(item)Celestium Dust$(0), $(item)Unholy Dust$(0), or $(item)Space Dust$(0).
divinityunbound.page.celestium_dust1: Rumor is that $(item)Celestium Dust$(0) can only be obtained if a $(item)Grain of Time$(0) is used on a magical golden block (like $(item)Golden Celestite Infused Stone$(0)) very close to the gods. $(thing)Might be worth trying very high up in the overworld.$(0)
divinityunbound.page.unholy_dust1: Many won't speak on how to obtain $(item)Unholy Dust$(0), but you managed to find a hint on how to create it from a scrap of paper.$(p)You think if a $(item)Grain of Time$(0) is used on an $(thing)indestructible block$(0) in the $(thing)Underworld$(0) you might be able to get some.
divinityunbound.page.space_dust1: You know that $(item)Space Dust$(0) is near $(thing)The End$(0) of the road for your quest of knowledge and power.$(p)You have heard that $(item)Obsidian$(0) has magical properties. The way it forms with lava and water is akin to the relationship of space and time.
divinityunbound.page.chronos_time_accumu: Now that you've managed to create a $(item)Chronos Clock$(0) you believe you can use it plus some $(item)Celestite Infused Stone$(0) and some $(item)Golden Celestite Infused Stone$(0) to start harnessing the power of time!
divinityunbound.page.unholy_wand0: The $(item)Unholy Wand$(0) utilizes the power imbued in the $(item)Wand Binding$(0) and $(item)Chronos Clock$(0) to force all the ores below a 3x3 area to the surface.
divinityunbound.page.divine_wand_of_flig: The $(item)Divine Wand of Flight$(0) is able to harness the power of full flight, albeit temporarily, due to the unique combination of an $(item)Elytra$(0) and the powerful $(item)Space Forged Ingot$(0).
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_respiration: The $(item)Wand of Respiration$(0) lets you gain control of the sea with the $(thing)Respiration$(0) and $(thing)Dolphin's Grace$(0) it provides.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_teleportati: The $(item)Wand of Teleportation$(0) allows you to feel like an Enderman and travel in style (teleportation!).$(p)Shift+Right Click on a block to save the coordinates to the wand, Right Click in air or on a block to be teleported to your saved coordinates.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_the_archer0: The $(item)Wand of Archer$(0) calls on the power of Apollo and allows you to summon spectral arrows that shoot directly from the wand.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_celebration: The $(item)Wand of Celebration$(0) is something Dionysus would cook up to have fun at parties. Be the life of the party by shooting off duration 3 rockets with this wand.$(p)Can be used on a block to shoot fireworks up or in air for use with an Elytra.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_fire_bendin: The $(item)Wand of Fire Bending$(0) is inspired by the sorcery some of Hades' minions use.$(p)It lets you temporarily summon lava directly from the Nether either on the block or mob you used the wand on.
This wand can be particularly nasty to go against in combat as it gives the user $(thing)Fire Resistance$(0) so they are immune to damage from the lava they just summoned.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_capturing0: The $(item)Wand of Capturing$(0) is one that has puzzled mages in magical academia for ages. Their best guess after millennia of research is that the captured entity is brought to a pocket dimension within the wand.
divinityunbound.page.wand_of_capturing1: Right click on a mob with the wand to capture it, right click on a block to release it. The wand will inform you what mob is captured in the pocket dimension in it's tooltip.
divinityunbound.page.proteus_converter0: The $(item)Proteus Converter$(0) is an ancient technology left abandoned by the gods. It was previously discovered by explorers in an Ocean Monument.
divinityunbound.page.proteus_converter1: The final block you should place to form the multiblock is the $(item)Proteus Controller$(0).
